item.title: [NTPC] NTPC Ltd Completes Acquisition of 1350MW Coal-based Thermal Power Plant
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

NTPC Ltd, in collaboration with Maharashtra State Power Generation Company Limited (MAHAGENCO), has successfully completed the acquisition of Sinnar Thermal Power Limited (STPL). The acquisition was carried out in accordance with the Resolution Plan approved by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code 2016 (IBC). STPL owns a 1350MW coal-based thermal power plant located in Sinnar, Nashik, Maharashtra. This acquisition increases NTPC group's total installed capacity to 88,132 MW and commercial capacity to 87,052 MW.

  • NTPC Ltd and MAHAGENCO complete acquisition of Sinnar Thermal Power Limited
  • Acquisition involves a 1350MW coal-based thermal power plant in Sinnar, Nashik, Maharashtra
  • Transaction completed in accordance with NCLT approved Resolution Plan under IBC 2016
  • NTPC group's total installed capacity now stands at 88,132 MW
  • Commercial capacity of NTPC group increased to 87,052 MW

item.title: [NATCOPHARM] Natco Pharma to Launch Semaglutide in India in March 2026 with Eris Lifesciences
item.description:
Natco Pharma Ltd has received approval from the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) for Semaglutide in India. The company is working with different marketing partners to launch the product in the month of March 2026 in India. Natco Pharma has formed a partnership with Eris Lifesciences Ltd for the said product, which is in the ordinary course of business and has no material impact on the operations of the company. The company has been consistently making disclosures to the Stock Exchanges as required under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (LODR) Regulations, 2015 and continues to adhere to the said regulations.

  • Natco Pharma has received approval from the CDSCO for Semaglutide in India
  • The company plans to launch Semaglutide in India in March 2026
  • Natco Pharma has partnered with Eris Lifesciences Ltd for the launch

item.title: [LT] L&T Secures Major Orders for Power Transmission Infrastructure in India and Abroad
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Larsen & Toubro Limited's Power Transmission & Distribution (PT&D) vertical has won a series of EPC orders for the establishment of electricity grid system elements in India and the Middle East. The Indian project involves the design, supply, and construction of two 220 kV Gas Insulated Substations in West Bengal, along with associated transmission line segments. The Middle Eastern projects include the turnkey construction of five substations and over 250 KM transmission lines, up to 500 kV level, in three different countries. These orders reflect the strong customer trust in L&T for safe, flawless, sustainable, and timely creation of grid backbone.

  • L&T's PT&D vertical secures EPC orders for electricity grid system elements in India and the Middle East.
  • Two 220 kV Gas Insulated Substations to be built in West Bengal's Durgapur-Raniganj-Asansol industrial belt.
  • Associated transmission line segments with advanced conductors and multi-circuit towers also included in the Indian project.
  • Five substations and over 250 KM transmission lines to be constructed in the Middle East, up to 500 kV level.
  • Orders reflect customer trust in L&T for safe, flawless, sustainable, and timely creation of grid backbone.

item.title: [JONJUA] Jonjua Air Limited, Promoter Group, Sells Portion of Holding in Jonjua Overseas Limited
item.description:
Jonjua Air Limited, a Promoter Group, has sold a portion of its holding in Jonjua Overseas Limited on 24/02/2026. The disclosure of this transaction is attached and is in compliance with Regulation 29 (2) of SEBI (SAST) Regulations, 2011, and other applicable rules and regulations. The sale details are as follows: Before the sale, Jonjua Air Limited held 12.16% of the total diluted share/voting capital of Jonjua Overseas Limited. Post-sale, their holding has reduced to 1.61%. The sale was conducted off-market. The equity share capital and total voting capital of Jonjua Overseas Limited remain unchanged at Rs. 10 each, with a total of 2,72,77,597 equity shares.

  • Jonjua Air Limited, a Promoter Group, sold a portion of its holding in Jonjua Overseas Limited.

item.title: [SUMUKAAG] Sumuka Agro Industries Fixes Record Date for Gujjubhai Foods Merger
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Sumuka Agro Industries Ltd. has fixed Monday, March 9, 2026, as the record date for determining the shareholders of Gujjubhai Foods Private Limited who shall be entitled to receive fully paid-up equity shares of Sumuka Agro Industries as per the share exchange ratio set out in the Scheme of Merger. This follows the sanction of the merger by the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench. The share exchange ratio is 7 (Seven) fully paid up equity shares of Sumuka Agro Industries for every 4 (Four) fully paid equity shares held by the shareholders of Gujjubhai Foods.

  • Sumuka Agro Industries has fixed March 9, 2026, as the record date for the merger with Gujjubhai Foods
  • The merger is based on a share exchange ratio of 7:4
  • The merger has been sanctioned by the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench
  • The record date is set for determining the shareholders of Gujjubhai Foods who shall be entitled to receive Sumuka Agro Industries shares
